description: Application for Non-Material Amendment to Planning Permission 21/03821/KPSID (Demolition of the existing CLASP building and the erection of a new 3 storey teaching block and adjoining sports hall to facilitate a 5 FE junior school, external works to the existing outdoor school playing areas, 2 no. Multi Use Games Areas (MUGA) (including one floodlit), new junior playground area, reconfiguration of internal access, new staff car parking area and cycle parking, works to the existing Victorian Block, new pedestrian access points, a new covered link, landscaping and other associated works. The school will be subject to a Community Use Agreement.) to allow amendments to Conditions 4 (Detailed Drawings) and 5 (Material Samples) to separate the requirement for the provision of MUGA details and delay the requirement for the landscaping scheme.
decision_conditions: The proposed amendments to planning permission 21/03821/KPSID are considered to be non-material.

Condition 5 (Material Samples) of planning permission 21/03821/KPSID that currently reads: 5. Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, samples of the facing materials to be utilised in the development to which this permission relates (including external lighting and boundary treatments (gates, fences etc) including details of manufacturing specification) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved samples. Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with pis amended as follows:5 (a) Prior to the commencement of works to the MUGA, samples of the facing materials (including external lighting and boundary treatments (gates, fences etc) including details of manufacturing specification) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.5 (b) Prior to the commencement of any above ground works of any other development, samples of the facing materials to be utilised in the development to which this permission relates (including external lighting and boundary treatments (gates, fences etc) including details of manufacturing specification) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Condition 4 (Detailed Drawings) of planning permission 21/03821/KPSID which currently reads: Prior to the commencement of above ground development, detailed drawings at a scale of 1:5 of the following features shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority:- all openings (windows, glazing systems, doors & public entrances, publicly visible vents andgrilles)- metal cladding & screening details- roof details- roof plant & enclosure (to include PV panels setting out if incorporated, and MVHR setting outand publicly visible intakes / exhausts)- brickwork (materials, mortar and jointing)- Rainwater goods- fencing, boundary treatment types and gates- Structures (covered link, play and exercise equipment, planters, refuse and cycle stores)- MUGA, playing fields (typical details)- SUDs - seating and other street furniture and lighting - surfacing, curb and edging details- signageThe developer shall submit a site plan / elevation and key plans / elevations where applicable associated with each detail identifying the location of each typical detail.The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the developmentis amended as follows:4 (a) Prior to the commencement of works to the MUGA and playing fields, typical details of the MUGA (detailed drawings at a scale of 1:5) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.The developer shall submit a site plan / elevation and key plans / elevations where applicable.The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings.4 (b) Prior to the commencement of any other work/development, detailed drawings at a scale of 1:5 of the following features shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority:o all openings (windows, glazing systems, doors & public entrances, publicly visible vents and grilles)o metal cladding & screening detailso roof detailso roof plant & enclosure (to include PV panels setting out if incorporated, and MVHR setting out and publicly visible intakes / exhausts)o brickwork (materials, mortar and jointing)o Rainwater goodso fencing, boundary treatment types and gateso Structures (covered link, play and exercise equipment (excluding MUGA equipment), planters, refuse and cycle stores)o SUDs - seating and other street furniture and lighting - surfacing, curb and edging detailso SignageThe developer shall submit a site plan / elevation and key plans / elevations where applicable associated with each detail identifying the location of each typical detail.The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development
